intro: Alsine rudbarensis, commonly known as the Rudbar alsine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Turkey. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are small and pinkish-white, often appearing in clusters along the stems. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil.
